intro: Chrysosplenium biondianum, commonly known as the Biondi's golden spleenwort, is a rare and delicate member of the Saxifragaceae family. It is a cryptogamic plant, characterized by its non-vascular structure and reliance on spores for reproduction. Native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
